cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles south of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeast toward the Florida Panhandle tonight, then sweeping across the southeast United States this weekend and moving offshore of North Carolina before passing south of New Jersey and turning east-northeast into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Florida Panhandle (Apalachicola–Panama City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches posted only along parts of the southeast Atlantic coast – none north of Cape Hatteras
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from the MS/AL border eastward to Yankeetown FL; storm-surge warning Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast (LA-FL), interior Southeast states, Atlantic coast from GA through the Carolinas and toward the Mid-Atlantic including NJ/DE coasts
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible Monday with peak sustained winds 20-30 mph and gusts to near gale force, but odds of sustained tropical-storm force winds remain below 5 %
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Delaware River or New Jersey side; water-level rise limited to minor tidal departures (<1 ft)
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain Monday could total 1–2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated surf and rip-current risk along NJ and DE beaches; isolated brief coastal flooding during high-tide cycles
